xxl.core.relational.cursors

Class NestedLoopsJoin

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      • xxl.core.cursors.joins.NestedLoopsJoin<Tuple,Tuple>
        • xxl.core.relational.cursors.NestedLoopsJoin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>

    public class NestedLoopsJoin
extends NestedLoopsJoin<Tuple,Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
    A nested-loops implementation of a flexible join operator.

    The following types of joins are available. For a complete discussion of join operations read the adequate chapter of a good book on database systems, e.g. "Datenbanksysteme" from Kemper, Eickler.

    • THETA_JOIN
    • LEFT_OUTER_JOIN
    • RIGHT_OUTER_JOIN
    • OUTER_JOIN
    • NATURAL_JOIN
    • SEMI_JOIN
    • CARTESIAN_PRODUCT
    Updates and removes are not supported.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • NestedLoopsJoin

        public NestedLoopsJoin(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor1,
                       MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor2,
                       Function<?,? extends MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> newCursor,
                       MetaDataPredicate<? super Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> predicate,
                       Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createTuple,
                       NestedLoopsJoin.Type type)
        Advanced constructor creating a new nested-loops join with lazy evaluation backed on two cursors using a metadata predicate to select the resulting tuples. This constructor also supports the handling of a non-resetable input metadata cursor, cursor2, because a parameterless function can be defined that returns this input metadata cursor. Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next. This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.

        Handle with care! Do not use this constructor if you do not know exactly what you are doing.

        Parameters:
        cursor1 - the input metadata cursor that is traversed in the "outer" loop.
        cursor2 - the input metadata cursor that is traversed in the "inner" loop.
        newCursor - a parameterless function that delivers a new metadata cursor, when the cursor cursor2 cannot be reset, i.e., cursor2.reset() will cause a UnsupportedOperationException.
        predicate - the predicate evaluated for each tuple of elements backed on one element of each input-cursor in order to select them. Only these tuples where the predicate's evaluation result is true have been qualified to be a result of the join-operation.
        createTuple - a factory method (function) that takes two parameters as arguments and is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next().
        type - the type of the join operation. Possible values are the elements of the enumeration defined above in this class.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified type is not valid.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the input metadata cursor cursor1 or cursor2 cannot be reseted.

      • NestedLoopsJoin

        public NestedLoopsJoin(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor1,
                       MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor2,
                       Function<?,? extends MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> newCursor,
                       Predicate<? super Tuple> theta,
                       Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createTuple)
        Creates a new nested-loops join which performs a theta join. Lazy evaluation is used backed on two cursors using a predicate to select the resulting tuples. This constructor also supports the handling of a non-resetable input metadata cursor, cursor2, because a parameterless function can be defined that returns this input metadata cursor. Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next. This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
        Parameters:
        cursor1 - the input metadata cursor that is traversed in the "outer" loop.
        cursor2 - the input metadata cursor that is traversed in the "inner" loop.
        newCursor - a parameterless function that delivers a new metadata cursor, when the cursor cursor2 cannot be reset, i.e., cursor2.reset() will cause a UnsupportedOperationException.
        theta - the predicate evaluated for each tuple of elements backed on one element of each input-cursor in order to select them. Only these tuples where the predicate's evaluation result is true have been qualified to be a result of the join-operation.
        createTuple - a factory method (function) that takes two parameters as arguments and is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified type is not valid.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the input metadata cursor cursor1 or cursor2 cannot be reseted.

      • NestedLoopsJoin

        public NestedLoopsJoin(MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor1,
                       MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>> cursor2,
                       Function<?,? extends MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>> newCursor,
                       Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createTuple,
                       NestedLoopsJoin.Type type)
        Creates a new nested-loops join with lazy evaluation backed on two cursors using a predicate to select the resulting tuples. This constructor also supports the handling of a non-resetable input metadata cursor, cursor2, because a parameterless function can be defined that returns this input metadata cursor. Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next. This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
        Parameters:

        cursor2 - the input metadata cursor that is traversed in the "inner" loop.
        newCursor - a parameterless function that delivers a new metadata cursor, when the cursor cursor2 cannot be reset, i.e., cursor2.reset() will cause a UnsupportedOperationException.
        createTuple - a factory method (function) that takes two parameters as arguments and is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next().

      • NestedLoopsJoin

        public NestedLoopsJoin(ResultSet resultSet1,
                       ResultSet resultSet2,
                       Function<?,? extends ResultSet> newResultSet,
                       Predicate<? super Tuple> predicate,
                       Function<Object,? extends Tuple> createTuple)
        Creates a new nested-loops join which performs a theta join. Lazy evaluation is used backed on two cursors using a predicate to select the resulting tuples. This constructor also supports the handling of a non-resetable input metadata cursor, cursor2, because a parameterless function can be defined that returns this input metadata cursor. Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next. This Function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
        Parameters:
        resultSet1 - the input result set that is traversed in the "outer" loop.
        resultSet2 - the input result set that is traversed in the "inner" loop.
        newResultSet - a function without parameters that delivers a new result set, when the iterating over the "inner" result set resultSet2 cannot be reset, i.e., cursor2.reset() will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.
        predicate - the predicate evaluated for each tuple of elements backed on one element of each input-cursor in order to select them. Only these tuples where the predicate's evaluation result is true have been qualified to be a result of the join-operation.
        createTuple - a factory method (function) that takes two parameters as arguments and is invoked on each tuple where the predicate's evaluation result is true, i.e. on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified type is not valid.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the input metadata cursor cursor1 or cursor2 cannot be reseted.

                       NestedLoopsJoin.Type type)
        Creates a new nested-loops join with lazy evaluation backed on two cursors using a predicate to select the resulting tuples. This constructor also supports the handling of a non-resetable input metadata cursor, cursor2, because a parameterless function can be defined that returns this input metadata cursor. Furthermore a function can be specified that is invoked on each qualifying tuple before it is returned to the caller concerning a call to next. This function is a kind of factory-method to model the resulting object.
        Parameters:

        resultSet2 - the input result set that is traversed in the "inner" loop.
        newResultSet - a function without parameters that delivers a new result set, when the iterating over the "inner" result set resultSet2 cannot be reset, i.e., cursor2.reset() will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.
